Extract

 

  The James Webb Space Telescope, expected to launch in 2018 (image above), will have the ability to search for the chemical signatures of life in alien atmospheres, however, we’re not sure how life begins or how pervasive it is, making it very difficult to pinpoint when and where to find it, scientists said during a session at the National Space Symposium held last week in Colorado Springs. “We don’t know how many planets we’re going to have to examine before we find life, and not finding it on 10 or 100 doesn’t mean it’s not there,” John Grunsfeld, NASA’s associate administrator for the science mission directorate said during the panel. “This may be very tricky.” “We can’t really tell what life is,” MIT astrophysicist and exoplane…
